name: Charles I of England
what_did:
Charles I was king during a time of big arguments about power.
He believed kings got their power from God and didn’t listen to Parliament.
This led to a war — and he was the first English king to be put on trial and executed.
why_matters:
Charles’s reign changed English history forever.
His death showed that kings could be held responsible.
He helped start the idea that rulers must follow laws too.
